description.compact: Set the kind of package, and erase all release tags

docblock.description: - a php package is a PEAR-style package - an extbin package is a PECL-style extension binary - an extsrc package is a PECL-style source for a binary - an zendextbin package is a PECL-style zend extension binary - an zendextsrc package is a PECL-style source for a zend extension binary - a bundle package is a collection of other pre-packaged packages

return.description: true if package type is set up

description.compact: Get the current release tag in order to add to it

param.description: returns only releases that have installcondition if true

description.compact: Add a file to the current release that should be installed under a different name

param.description: name the file should be installed as

description.compact: Add a file to the current release that should be ignored

docblock.description: Note that the package must be from the same channel as the extension source package

description.compact: Add a configureoption to an extension source package
Set an installation condition based on php version for the current release set
Set an installation condition based on operating system for the current release set

param.description: whether this OS is incompatible with the current release

description.compact: Set an installation condition based on architecture for the current release set

param.description: whether this arch is incompatible with the current release

description.compact: For extension binary releases, this is used to specify either the static URI to a source package, or the package name and channel of the extsrc/zendextsrc package it is based on.

param.description: Package name, or full URI to source package (extsrc/zendextsrc type)

description.compact: Generate a valid change log entry from the current package.xml

description.compact: Remove the changelog entirely
Parsed package information
path to package .tgz or false if this is a local/extracted package.xml
path to package .xml or false if this is an abstract parsed-from-string xml
This is used by file analysis routines to log progress information
This is set to the highest validation level that has been validated

docblock.description: If the package.xml is invalid or unknown, this is set to 0. If normal validation has occurred, this is set to PEAR_VALIDATE_NORMAL. If downloading/installation validation has occurred it is set to PEAR_VALIDATE_DOWNLOADING or INSTALLING, and so on up to PEAR_VALIDATE_PACKAGING. This allows validation "caching" to occur, which is particularly important for package validation, so that PHP files are not validated twice

description.compact: True if the filelist has been validated
Optional Dependency group requested for installation
Namespace prefix used for tasks in this package.xml - use tasks: whenever possible
Determines whether this packagefile was initialized only with partial package info

docblock.description:

- package name - channel name - dependencies

description.compact: Determines whether this package claims it is compatible with the version of the package that has a recommended version dependency
Determines whether the passed in package is a subpackage of this package.

docblock.description: No version checking is done, only name verification.

description.compact: Get the contents of a dependency group
Retrieve a partial package.xml 1.0 representation of dependencies

docblock.description: a very limited representation of dependencies is returned by this method. The <exclude> tag for excluding certain versions of a dependency is completely ignored. In addition, dependency groups are ignored, with the assumption that all dependencies in dependency groups are also listed in the optional group that work with all dependency groups

description.compact: Get the contents of a file listed within the package.xml
Determine whether a task name is a valid task. Custom tasks may be defined using subdirectories by putting a "-" in the name, as in <tasks:mycustom-task>

docblock.description: Note that this method will auto-load the task class file and test for the existence of the name with "-" replaced by "_" as in PEAR/Task/mycustom/task.php makes class PEAR_Task_mycustom_task

comment.value: transform all '-' to '/' and 'tasks:' to '' so tasks:replace becomes replace
